ðŸ’¡ wl-kbptr | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Control the mouse pointer with the keyboard on Wayland compositors.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Moves mouse pointer with keyboard â€¢ Supports multiple modes: floating, tile, bisect, split, click â€¢ Configurable selection areas â€¢ Supports screen capture for target detection (opencv) â€¢ Works with Wayland compositors (Sway, Hyprland, Niri, dwl)
ðŸ“– Summary: wl-kbptr is a utility that enables users to control the mouse pointer using the keyboard on Wayland. It offers various modes for selecting target areas, including floating, tile, bisect, split, and click, and supports compositors like Sway and Hyprland. It can also use screen capture for automatic target detection.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ waydroid | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Running Android applications on GNU/Linux systems
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Container-based approach to run Android on Linux â€¢ Uses Linux namespaces for isolation â€¢ Direct hardware access for Android system â€¢ Based on LineageOS
ðŸ“– Summary: Waydroid enables users to run a complete Android system within a container on a GNU/Linux operating system. It leverages Linux namespaces to provide isolation and direct hardware access for the Android environment. The system image is based on LineageOS, allowing users to run Android applications seamlessly on their Linux desktops.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ gmail-tui | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Accessing and managing Gmail through a terminal user interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Compose email â€¢ Read email â€¢ Reply to email
ðŸ“– Summary: The gmail-tui repository provides a terminal-based email client for Gmail, written in Go. It allows users to compose, read, and reply to emails directly from their terminal. The project is still under development, focusing on improving functionality and user experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ SploitScan | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Identifying exploits for known vulnerabilities and assessing their exploitation probability.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ CVE Information Retrieval â€¢ EPSS Integration â€¢ Public Exploits Aggregation â€¢ CISA KEV Integration â€¢ AI-Powered Risk Assessment
ðŸ“– Summary: SploitScan is a cybersecurity utility designed to streamline the process of identifying exploits for known vulnerabilities. It aggregates data from various sources, including ExploitDB, CISA KEV, and HackerOne, and provides AI-powered risk assessments to help prioritize patching efforts. The tool also supports importing vulnerability scanner results and offers flexible export options.

ðŸš€ awesome-free-apps | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Discovering free and useful applications for various platforms.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Curated list of free apps â€¢ Categorized by platform (Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS) â€¢ Filters for open-source and recommended apps â€¢ Categorized by function (Audio, Browsers, Communication, etc.)
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a curated list of free applications for PC and mobile devices, categorized by platform and function. It offers filters to easily find open-source or recommended apps, making it a valuable resource for users seeking free alternatives to paid software.
